texts: {"template":"intro","texts":["You have to become a member to use Dial-a-Ride."],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
You must have a permanent or long-term disability which means you are unable to use public transport.
You are automatically eligible for membership if you are:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["A Taxicard member","Getting the Higher Rate Mobility Component of Disability Living Allowance","Getting the Standard or Enhanced Mobility Rate of the Personal Independence Payment (PIP)","Registered blind or partially sighted","Aged 85 or over","Getting a Higher Rate Attendance Allowance","Getting a War Pension Mobility Supplement"]}
If none of the above apply to you, you may still be able to join Dial-a-Ride but you will have to undergo a paper-based mobility assessment to establish your eligibility for the service.

You can apply for Dial-a-Ride if you are a permanent or temporary resident of a London borough. If you are applying for a temporary membership, you will need to provide evidence of using a similar service at your place of residence.

To apply, download the form below, complete it, and post it to:
Dial-A-Ride
Assisted Transport Services
PO Box 68799
You can also phone us on 0343 222 7777 ( TfL call charges ) to request an application form.
Find out what will happen on your journey .

{"template":"listgroup","style":"nocard","links":[{"title":"Dial-a-Ride application form","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/dial-a-ride-application-form.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 169KB","image":{}},{"title":"How to fill in a Dial-a-Ride application","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/how-to-fill-in-a-dial-a-ride-application-form.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 102KB","image":{}}],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
Taxicard is an alternative taxi and minicab service that provides transport for London residents with mobility or sight impairments. Find out more about Taxicard .
